H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H8394.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H5324.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7176.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall; ≈ poetic term

H3996.def: = the act of people coming towards a point of reference and gathering together

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H6612.def: = person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H6195.def: = state in which someone is able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H5057.def: = a person in a position of high authority over a nation, a division of priests or levites, or an army

H4669.def: literally: opening of lips; hence: = action by which humans speak

H4339.def: = state in which an object has a relativedly flat surface, where people and objects can move without obstacles; ≈ associated with security and prosperity

H2441.def: = upper part of mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body

H1897.def: = causative action by which humans causes other humans or objects to be removed from their place,◄ as if by blowing them away

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H7562.def: = action by which humans or deities act in a way that is contrary to (God's) law, ► resulting in a state of guilt

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H6617.def: literally: to wrestle; hence: = action by which humans are in a fierce competition with other humans and make a huge effort to prevail over the other

H6141.def: literally: to be crooked (of a person); hence: = state in which  humans lack integrity in everything they think or do

H5228.def: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H6443.def: = a precious stone consisting of corundum in colour varieties varying from deep crimson or purple to pale rose; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H6195.def: = state in which someone is able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H4209.def: = plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H1347.def: = dense growth of shrubbery or small trees, habitat of animals

H1344.def: = state in which humans have an elevated status in their own eyes, ≈ which is seen as a negative and undesirable attitude for humans

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H8419.def: literally: crookedness; hence: = state in which humans cannot be trusted to do the right thing or make the right choices in life

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H4427.def: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people

H7336.def: used in poetry only; = ruler of a nation or people

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H2710.def: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

H8269.def: = someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere

H8323.def: = state in which humans are in a position of authority over a group of people

H5081.def: = state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H7836.def: = process by which the color of an object turns darker until it is (almost) black

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H6239.def: = state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H6337.def: = {L:gold<SDBH:זָהָב>} refined to a high level of purity; ≈ considered rare, beautiful and very valuable

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H5157.def: = action by which humans or deities take permanent possession of objects, humans, or property, either by inheritance or force

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7069.def: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way

H7225.def: = point in time at which an event starts happening

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4659.def: = an activity performed by a deity

H227.def: = referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5258.def: = causative action by which humans pour out a liquid, ≈ exclusively used for libations

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H4599.def: = an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing

H3513.def: = state in which objects have relatively much weight, ≈ which is often associated with slowness, functioning with difficulty, but also with importance, riches, status, etc.

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2962.def: = a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H2883.def: = process by which humans or objects is lowered into a space of restricted movement

H1389.def: = an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a {L:mountain<SDBH:הַר>}

H2342.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H6083.def: = the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

H8398.def: primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H2710.def: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

H2329.def: = dome-shaped structure; used exclusively to denote the firmament, which separates the waters above the earth from the earth itself; ≈ God is said to have his dwelling-place above this structure; it is also regarded as the boundary between light and darkness

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H553.def: = state in which humans have political and/or military strength

H4605.def: = action by which humans do something to (other) humans or deities that is not in line with the behavior that they committed themselves to

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H5810.def: = state in which humans or deities have the ability to exert force

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H2710.def: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

H4144.def: = the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it; sometimes used in a somewhat figurative sense to denote the foundations of heaven and earth

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H525.def: = person with skills for a specific craft

H681.def: relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H8398.def: primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H8245.def: = state in which humans are unable to sleep

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1817.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H4201.def: = upright part of a door frame; a few passages mention square door frames and in such cases the horizontal elements are also referred to as doorposts

H6607.def: literally: opening up of words; hence: = causative process by which deities make words easier to understand

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H6329.def: = state in which an object stands unsteadily

H7522.def: = state in which deities or humans in a position of authority are favorable disposed towards a person or activity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2554.def: = action by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans with which they have a relationship; ► usually in order to enrich themselves in one way or another

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living
